description: Learn the art of Low-Fidelity wireframing and High-Fidelity mockups, including Grids, Color, and Typography.

slides.title: Low vs High Fidelity
slides.content:
# The Spectrum üìâüìà

1.  **Sketching:** Pen & paper. Fast. Disposable. Idea generation.
2.  **Wireframing (Lo-Fi):** Digital grayscale structure. Layout focus. No detailed design.
3.  **Mockup (Hi-Fi):** Static UI design. Colors, fonts, shadows, images. The "skin".
4.  **Prototype:** Interactive Mockup.

slides.title: Wireframing Principles
slides.content:
# Wireframing Best Practices üìù

- **Keep it Grayscale:** Don't use color (it distracts).
- **Use Placeholders:** Use boxes with an "X" for images.
- **Lorem Ipsum:** Use placeholder text (or draft copy if available).
- **Focus on Hierarchy:** What is the most important element on the page?

slides.title: Grid Systems
slides.content:
# The Grid üï∏Ô∏è

Designers use grids to align elements.

**8pt Grid System:**
Indices: Multiples of 8 (8, 16, 24, 32, 40).
Most popular system. Why? Multiples of 8 scale perfectly on all screen sizes (@1x, @1.5x, @2x).

slides.title: Bootstrap Grid
slides.content:
# 12-Column Grid üìè

Standard for web design.

- **12** columns total.
- **Gutter:** Space between columns (usually 20px-24px).
- **Margin:** Space outside the grid.

You can span elements across columns (e.g., card takes 4 columns = 3 cards per row).

slides.title: System Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which grid system is the industry standard for spacing and sizing?

slides.title: Color Palettes
slides.content:
# Choosing Colors üé®

Don't just pick random colors.

1.  **Primary:** Brand color (Button background, Links).
2.  **Secondary:** Complements primary.
3.  **Background:** White, Light Gray, or Dark Gray.
4.  **Surface:** Card backgrounds.
5.  **Error/Success:** Red/Green.

Use tools like **Coolors.co** or **Adobe Color**.

slides.title: Typography Choices
slides.content:
# Typography System üÖ∞Ô∏è

Define your type scale early.

Example:
- **H1:** 32px (Bold)
- **H2:** 24px (Semi-Bold)
- **Body:** 16px (Regular)
- **Caption:** 12px (Regular, Gray)

Limit yourself to 1 or 2 font families.

slides.title: Using White Space
slides.content:
# White Space (Negative Space) ‚¨ú

The space between elements.

- It is NOT wasted space.
- It improves readability.
- It creates groupings.
- It adds elegance.

Rule: If in doubt, add more padding.

slides.title: Stock Assets
slides.content:
# Using Assets üñºÔ∏è

For Mockups, use high-quality assets.

- **Photos:** Unsplash, Pexels.
- **Icons:** Material Icons, Feather Icons, FontAwesome.
- **Illustrations:** Undraw, Humaaans.

Never use watermarked images.

slides.title: Components & Patterns
slides.content:
# UI Patterns üß©

Don't reinvent the wheel. Users are used to standard patterns.

- **Navigation:** Top bar or Hamburger menu.
- **Actions:** Floating Action Button (FAB) or Primary Button.
- **Forms:** Labels above inputs.

Consistency > ‚ÄúUnique Creativity‚Äù for usability.

slides.title: Design Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What is the term for the empty space between design elements?

slides.title: Mockup Tools
slides.content:
# Presentation Tools üñ•Ô∏è

Show off your mockups inside device frames.

- **Rotato:** 3D device mockups.
- **Mockuuups Studio:** Drag and drop.
- **Figma Community:** Thousands of free device frames (iPhone, MacBook, Browser).

Good presentation sells the design.

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Mockups üéì

From skeleton to skin.

- **Wireframe:** Structure first, grayscale.
- **Grid:** Use 8pt grid for alignment.
- **Typography:** Define a hierarchy (H1, H2, Body).
- **Color:** 60-30-10 rule.
- **Assets:** Use high quality, royalty-free resources.
